intro: Peucedanum wulongense, commonly known as Wulong mountain angelica, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and compound leaves with a distinctive fern-like appearance. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. The roots of Peucedanum wulongense are often used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits.
